      • getIndicesComparator

        public final java.util.Comparator<int[]> getIndicesComparator()
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        Returns a comparator that orders indices arrays.

        If JointDomainIndexer.supportsJointIndexing(), this is guaranteed to produce the same order as the natural order of the corresponding joint indexes. If not JointDomainIndexer.isDirected() or JointDomainIndexer.hasCanonicalDomainOrder(), then the comparator implements a reverse lexicographical ordering (see Comparators.reverseLexicalIntArray()).

        The comparator is intended to be used with arrays of length DomainList.size().

        Overrides:
        getIndicesComparator in class LargeJointDomainIndexer

      • getInputDomainIndices

        public int[] getInputDomainIndices()
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        Returns a copy of the indexes of the input domains listed in increasing order or else null if not JointDomainIndexer.isDirected().

        Use JointDomainIndexer.getInputDomainIndex(int) to lookup an index without allocating a new array object.

        Overrides:
        getInputDomainIndices in class JointDomainIndexer

      • getInputDomainIndex

        public int getInputDomainIndex(int i)
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        Returns the index of the ith domain designated as an input domain.

        This is equivalent to returning the ith element of JointDomainIndexer.getInputDomainIndices() but without having to allocate and copy an array.

        Overrides:
        getInputDomainIndex in class JointDomainIndexer

        Overrides:

      • getInputSize

        public int getInputSize()
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        The number of input domains if JointDomainIndexer.isDirected(), otherwise zero.

        If directed, this must be greater than zero and when combined with JointDomainIndexer.getOutputSize() must add up to DomainList.size().

        Overrides:
        getInputSize in class JointDomainIndexer

      • getOutputCardinality

        public int getOutputCardinality()
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        The number of possible combinations of output domain elements. Equal to the product of all of the output domain sizes. Will be the same as JointDomainIndexer.getCardinality() if not JointDomainIndexer.isDirected().
        Overrides:
        getOutputCardinality in class LargeJointDomainIndexer
        See Also:
        JointDomainIndexer.getInputCardinality()

      • getOutputDomainIndex

        public int getOutputDomainIndex(int i)
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        Returns the index of the ith output domain. If not JointDomainIndexer.isDirected() this treats all domains as output domains and will just return i if within range.
        Overrides:
        getOutputDomainIndex in class JointDomainIndexer

      • getOutputDomainIndices

        public int[] getOutputDomainIndices()
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        Returns a copy of the indexes of the input domains listed in increasing order or else null if not JointDomainIndexer.isDirected().

        Use JointDomainIndexer.getOutputDomainIndex(int) to lookup an index without allocating a new array object.

        Overrides:
        getOutputDomainIndices in class JointDomainIndexer

      • getOutputSize

        public int getOutputSize()
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        The number of output domains if JointDomainIndexer.isDirected(), otherwise the same as DomainList.size().

        If directed, this must be greater than zero and when combined with JointDomainIndexer.getInputSize() must add up to DomainList.size().

        Overrides:
        getOutputSize in class JointDomainIndexer

      • hasCanonicalDomainOrder

        public boolean hasCanonicalDomainOrder()
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        True if not JointDomainIndexer.isDirected(). Otherwise, if JointDomainIndexer.isDirected(), then this is true if all the output domains in JointDomainIndexer.getOutputSet() are at the front of the list.
        Overrides:
        hasCanonicalDomainOrder in class JointDomainIndexer

      • hasSameInputs

        public boolean hasSameInputs(int[] indices1,
                    int[] indices2)
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        Returns true if two indices arrays have the same values at the indexes specified by JointDomainIndexer.getInputDomainIndices(). If not JointDomainIndexer.isDirected(), this will always return true.
        Overrides:
        hasSameInputs in class JointDomainIndexer

      • isDirected

        public boolean isDirected()
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        True if domain list is partitioned into inputs and outputs.
        Overrides:
        isDirected in class JointDomainIndexer

      • outputIndexFromElements

        public int outputIndexFromElements(java.lang.Object... elements)
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        Computes a unique index for the subset of elements designated as outputs.

        Similar to JointDomainIndexer.jointIndexFromElements(Object...) but computes value only from those elements indexed by JointDomainIndexer.getOutputSet().

        Same as JointDomainIndexer.jointIndexFromElements(Object...) if not JointDomainIndexer.isDirected().

        Overrides:
        outputIndexFromElements in class JointDomainIndexer
        See Also:
        JointDomainIndexer.outputIndexFromIndices(int...), JointDomainIndexer.inputIndexFromElements(Object...)

      • outputIndexFromIndices

        public int outputIndexFromIndices(int... indices)
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        Computes a unique index for the subset of indices designated as outputs.

        Similar to JointDomainIndexer.jointIndexFromIndices(int...) but computes value only from those element indices designated by JointDomainIndexer.getOutputSet().

        Same as JointDomainIndexer.jointIndexFromIndices(int...) if not JointDomainIndexer.isDirected().

        Overrides:
        outputIndexFromIndices in class JointDomainIndexer
        See Also:
        JointDomainIndexer.outputIndexFromElements(Object...), JointDomainIndexer.inputIndexFromIndices(int...)

      • outputIndexFromValues

        public int outputIndexFromValues(Value... values)
        Overrides:
        outputIndexFromValues in class JointDomainIndexer

      • outputIndexToElements

        public void outputIndexToElements(int outputIndex,
                         java.lang.Object[] elements)
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        Writes elements corresponding to outputIndex into corresponding elements array.

        Only updates members of elements designated as outputs, so this will only update all of the elements if not JointDomainIndexer.isDirected().

        Overrides:
        outputIndexToElements in class JointDomainIndexer
        Parameters:
        outputIndex - must be in range [0, JointDomainIndexer.getOutputCardinality()-1].
        elements - must have length equal to DomainList.size().

        See Also:
        JointDomainIndexer.outputIndexFromElements(Object...), JointDomainIndexer.inputIndexToElements(int, Object[])

      • outputIndexToIndices

        public void outputIndexToIndices(int outputIndex,
                        int[] indices)
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        Writes element indices corresponding to outputIndex into corresponding indices array.

        Only updates members of indices for domains designated as inputs, and therefore will do nothing if not JointDomainIndexer.isDirected().

        Overrides:
        outputIndexToIndices in class JointDomainIndexer
        Parameters:
        outputIndex - must be in range [0, JointDomainIndexer.getOutputCardinality()-1].
        indices - must have length equal to DomainList.size().

        See Also:
        JointDomainIndexer.outputIndexFromIndices(int...)

      • outputIndexToValues

        public void outputIndexToValues(int outputIndex,
                       Value[] values)
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        Writes elements corresponding to outputIndex into corresponding elements array.

        Only updates members of elements designated as outputs, so this will only update all of the elements if not JointDomainIndexer.isDirected().

        Overrides:
        outputIndexToValues in class JointDomainIndexer
        Parameters:
        outputIndex - must be in range [0, JointDomainIndexer.getOutputCardinality()-1].
        values - must have length equal to DomainList.size() and must be fully populated (i.e. no null entries) with Value objects with domain compatible with corresponding indexer domains.

      • supportsOutputIndexing

        public boolean supportsOutputIndexing()
        Description copied from class: JointDomainIndexer
        Indicates whether class supports operations involving single integer output index representation of the subset of domains identified by JointDomainIndexer.getOutputSet(). This will be false when the joint cardinality of the component output domains is larger than 231. Note that this can be true when JointDomainIndexer.supportsJointIndexing() is false.
        Overrides:
        supportsOutputIndexing in class LargeJointDomainIndexer
